page.title: 12 EDUCATION
page.content: Educational facilities within the area range from playgroups,for pre-school age children to colleges for Further Education. For children of school age there are:Infant schools for ages 5 to 7; Junior schools for ages 7 to 11; Secondary Modern or Grammar Schools for ages 11 to 16,plus sixth forms at Grammar Schools for the 16 to 18 age group. Unlike many parts of Kent,the area has a selection procedure at age 11for the most suitable type of secondary education for each child.This involves a reasoning test,a school's assessment of each child and parental wishes. Following this, each child on leaving Junior school will attend either a Secondary Modern School or a Grammar School. The area also offers a Youth Training Scheme to enable unemployed school leavers to learn a skill
